   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(op_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,
   26:          bsl_bsr/1,logical/1,t_not/1,relop_simple/1,relop/1,
   27:          complex_relop/1,unsafe_fusing/1,
   28:          range_tests/1,combined_relops/1,typed_relop/1]).
   29: 
   30: -import(lists, [foldl/3,flatmap/2]).
   31: 
   32: suite() ->
   33:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   34:      {timetrap, {minutes, 5}}].
   35: 
   36: all() ->
   37:     [bsl_bsr, logical, t_not, relop_simple, relop,
   38:      complex_relop, unsafe_fusing, range_tests,
   39:      combined_relops, typed_relop].
   40: 
   41: %% Test the bsl and bsr operators.
   42: bsl_bsr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   43:     RawValues = [-16#8000009-2,-1,0,1,2,73,16#8000000,bad,[]],
   44: 
   45:     [bsl_bsr_const(V) || V <- RawValues],
   46: 
   47:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- RawValues],
   48:     %% Try to use less memory by splitting the cases
   49: 
   50:     Cases1 = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['bsl'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
   51:     N1 = length(Cases1),
   52:     run_test_module(Cases1, false),
   53: 
   54:     Cases2 = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['bsr'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
   55:     N2 = length(Cases2),
   56:     run_test_module(Cases2, false),
   57: 
   58:     {comment,integer_to_list(N1 + N2) ++ " cases"}.
   59: 
   60: %% Tests constant-argument optimizations in `bsl`/`bsr`
   61: bsl_bsr_const(A) ->
   62:     BSL = id('bsl'),
   63:     BSR = id('bsr'),
   64: 
   65:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(1, A)), (catch 1 bsl A)),
   66:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(3, A)), (catch 3 bsl A)),
   67:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(7, A)), (catch 7 bsl A)),
   68: 
   69:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 1)), (catch A bsl 1)),
   70:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 3)), (catch A bsl 3)),
   71:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, 7)), (catch A bsl 7)),
   72: 
   73:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-2, A)), (catch -2 bsl A)),
   74:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-4, A)), (catch -4 bsl A)),
   75:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(-8, A)), (catch -8 bsl A)),
   76: 
   77:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -2)), (catch A bsl -2)),
   78:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -4)), (catch A bsl -4)),
   79:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(A, -8)), (catch A bsl -8)),
   80: 
   81:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(1, A)), (catch 1 bsr A)),
   82:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(3, A)), (catch 3 bsr A)),
   83:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(7, A)), (catch 7 bsr A)),
   84: 
   85:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 1)), (catch A bsr 1)),
   86:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 3)), (catch A bsr 3)),
   87:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, 7)), (catch A bsr 7)),
   88: 
   89:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-2, A)), (catch -2 bsr A)),
   90:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-4, A)), (catch -4 bsr A)),
   91:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(-8, A)), (catch -8 bsr A)),
   92: 
   93:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -2)), (catch A bsr -2)),
   94:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -4)), (catch A bsr -4)),
   95:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(A, -8)), (catch A bsr -8)),
   96: 
   97: 
   98:     %% These numbers can be shifted left one or zero times while remaining a
   99:     %% small on 32-bit platforms.
  100:     %%
  101:     %% The test relies on the compiler turning these into constants.
  102:     HighEdge32 = (1 bsl (32 - 6)) - 1,
  103:     LowEdge32 = -(1 bsl (32 - 6)),
  104: 
  105:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(HighEdge32, A)), (catch HighEdge32 bsl A)),
  106:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(LowEdge32, A)), (catch LowEdge32 bsl A)),
  107:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(HighEdge32, A)), (catch HighEdge32 bsr A)),
  108:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(LowEdge32, A)), (catch LowEdge32 bsr A)),
  109: 
  110:     HighEdge64 = (1 bsl (64 - 6)) - 1,
  111:     LowEdge64 = -(1 bsl (64 - 6)),
  112: 
  113:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(HighEdge64, A)), (catch HighEdge64 bsl A)),
  114:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSL(LowEdge64, A)), (catch LowEdge64 bsl A)),
  115:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(HighEdge64, A)), (catch HighEdge64 bsr A)),
  116:     bsl_bsr_compare_results((catch erlang:BSR(LowEdge64, A)), (catch LowEdge64 bsr A)),
  117: 
  118:     ok.
  119: 
  120: bsl_bsr_compare_results(Same, Same) ->
  121:     ok;
  122: bsl_bsr_compare_results({'EXIT',{Reason,[_|_]}}, {'EXIT',{Reason,[_|_]}}) ->
  123:     %% The applied and inlined implementations may differ in whether they include
  124:     %% the operator as the top element of the stack.
  125:     ok.
  126: 
  127: %% Test the logical operators and internal BIFs.
  128: logical(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  129:     Vs0 = [true,false,bad],
  130:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- Vs0],
  131:     Cases = [{Op,X,Y} || Op <- ['and','or','xor'], X <- Vs, Y <- Vs],
  132:     run_test_module(Cases, false),
  133:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(Cases)) ++ " cases"}.
  134: 
  135: %% Test the not operator and internal BIFs.
  136: t_not(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  137:     Cases = [{'not',unvalue(V)} || V <- [true,false,42,bad]],
  138:     run_test_module(Cases, false),
  139:     {comment,integer_to_list(length(Cases)) ++ " cases"}.
  140: 
  141: %% Test that simlpe relations between relation operators hold.
  142: relop_simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  143:     Big1 = 19738924729729787487784874,
  144:     Big2 = 38374938373887374983978484,
  145:     F1 = float(Big1),
  146:     F2 = float(Big2),
  147:     T1 = erlang:make_tuple(3,87),
  148:     T2 = erlang:make_tuple(3,87),
  149:     Terms = [-F2,Big2,-F1,-Big1,-33,-33.0,0,0.0,42,42.0,Big1,F1,Big2,F2,a,b,
  150:              {T1,a},{T2,b},[T1,Big1],[T2,Big2]],
  151: 
  152:     Combos = [{V1,V2} || V1 <- Terms, V2 <- Terms],
  153: 
  154:     lists:foreach(fun({A,B}) -> relop_simple_do(A,B) end,
  155:                   Combos),
  156: 
  157:     repeat(fun() ->
  158:                    Size = rand:uniform(100),
  159:                    Rnd1 = make_rand_term(Size),
  160:                    {Rnd2,0} = clone_and_mutate(Rnd1, rand:uniform(Size)),
  161:                    relop_simple_do(Rnd1,Rnd2)
  162:            end,
  163:            1000),
  164:     ok.
  165: 
  166: relop_simple_do(V1,V2) ->
  167:     %%io:format("compare ~p\n   and  ~p\n",[V1,V2]),
  168: 
  169:     L = V1 < V2,
  170:     L = not (V1 >= V2),
  171:     L = V2 > V1,
  172:     L = not (V2 =< V1),
  173: 
  174:     G = V1 > V2,
  175:     G = not (V1 =< V2),
  176:     G = V2 < V1,
  177:     G = not (V2 >= V1),
  178: 
  179:     ID = V1 =:= V2,
  180:     ID = V2 =:= V1,
  181:     ID = not (V1 =/= V2),
  182:     ID = not (V2 =/= V1),
  183: 
  184:     EQ = V1 == V2,
  185:     EQ = V2 == V1,
  186:     EQ = not (V1 /= V2),
  187:     EQ = not (V2 /= V1),
  188: 
  189:     case {L, EQ, ID, G, cmp_emu(V1,V2)} of
  190:         { true, false, false, false, -1} -> ok;
  191:         {false, true,  false, false,  0} -> ok;
  192:         {false, true,   true, false,  0} -> ok;
  193:         {false, false, false, true,  +1} -> ok
  194:     end.
  195: 
  196: %% Emulate internal "cmp"
  197: cmp_emu(A,B) when is_tuple(A), is_tuple(B) ->
  198:     SA = size(A),
  199:     SB = size(B),
  200:     if SA =:= SB -> cmp_emu(tuple_to_list(A),tuple_to_list(B));
  201:        SA > SB -> +1;
  202:        SA < SB -> -1
  203:     end;
  204: cmp_emu([A|TA],[B|TB]) ->
  205:     case cmp_emu(A,B) of
  206:         0   -> cmp_emu(TA,TB);
  207:         CMP -> CMP
  208:     end;
  209: cmp_emu(A,B) ->
  210:     %% We cheat and use real "cmp" for the primitive types.
  211:     if A < B -> -1;
  212:        A > B -> +1;
  213:        true -> 0
  214:     end.					              
  215: 
  216: make_rand_term(1) ->
  217:     make_rand_term_single();
  218: make_rand_term(Arity) ->
  219:     case rand:uniform(3) of
  220:         1 ->
  221:             make_rand_list(Arity);
  222:         2 ->
  223:             list_to_tuple(make_rand_list(Arity));
  224:         3 ->
  225:             {Car,Rest} = make_rand_term_rand_size(Arity),
  226:             [Car|make_rand_term(Rest)]
  227:     end.
  228: 
  229: make_rand_term_single() ->
  230:     Range = 1 bsl rand:uniform(200),
  231:     case rand:uniform(12) of
  232:         1 -> random;
  233:         2 -> uniform;
  234:         3 -> rand:uniform(Range) - (Range div 2);
  235:         4 -> Range * (rand:uniform() - 0.5);
  236:         5 -> 0;
  237:         6 -> 0.0;
  238:         7 -> make_ref();
  239:         8 -> self();
  240:         9 -> term_to_binary(rand:uniform(Range));
  241:         10 -> fun(X) -> X*Range end; 
  242:         11 -> fun(X) -> X/Range end;
  243:         12 -> []
  244:     end.	    
  245: 
  246: make_rand_term_rand_size(1) ->
  247:     {make_rand_term(1), 0};
  248: make_rand_term_rand_size(MaxArity) ->
  249:     Arity = rand:uniform(MaxArity-1),
  250:     {make_rand_term(Arity), MaxArity-Arity}.
  251: 
  252: make_rand_list(0) -> [];
  253: make_rand_list(Arity) ->
  254:     {Term, Rest} = make_rand_term_rand_size(Arity),
  255:     [Term | make_rand_list(Rest)].
  256: 
  257: 
  258: clone_and_mutate(Term, 0) ->
  259:     {clone(Term), 0};
  260: clone_and_mutate(_Term, 1) ->
  261:     {Mutation, _} = make_rand_term_rand_size(10), % MUTATE!
  262:     {Mutation, 0};
  263: clone_and_mutate(Term, Cnt) when is_tuple(Term) ->
  264:     {Clone,NewCnt} = clone_and_mutate(tuple_to_list(Term),Cnt),
  265:     {my_list_to_tuple(Clone), NewCnt};
  266: clone_and_mutate([Term|Tail], Cnt) ->
  267:     {Car,Cnt1} = clone_and_mutate(Term,Cnt),
  268:     {Cdr,Cnt2} = clone_and_mutate(Tail,Cnt1),
  269:     {[Car | Cdr], Cnt2};
  270: clone_and_mutate(Term, Cnt) ->
  271:     {clone(Term), Cnt-1}.
  272: 
  273: clone(Term) ->
  274:     binary_to_term(term_to_binary(Term)).
  275: 
  276: my_list_to_tuple(List) ->
  277:     try list_to_tuple(List)
  278:     catch
  279:         error:badarg -> 
  280:             %%io:format("my_list_to_tuple got badarg exception.\n"),
  281:             list_to_tuple(purify_list(List))
  282:     end.
  283: 
  284: purify_list(List) ->
  285:     lists:reverse(purify_list(List, [])).
  286: purify_list([], Acc) -> Acc;
  287: purify_list([H|T], Acc) -> purify_list(T, [H|Acc]);
  288: purify_list(Other, Acc) -> [Other|Acc].
  289: 
  290: 
  291: %% Test the relational operators and internal BIFs on literals.
  292: relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  293:     Big1 = -38374938373887374983978484,
  294:     Big2 = 19738924729729787487784874,
  295:     F1 = float(Big1),
  296:     F2 = float(Big2),
  297:     Bin = <<"abc">>,
  298:     BitString = <<0:7>>,
  299:     Map = #{a => b},
  300:     Vs0 = [a,b,-33,-33.0,0,0.0,42,42.0,Big1,Big2,F1,F2,
  301:            Bin,BitString,Map],
  302:     Vs = [unvalue(V) || V <- Vs0],
  303:     Ops = ['==', '/=', '=:=', '=/=', '<', '=<', '>', '>='],
  304:     binop(Ops, Vs).
  305: 
  306: %% Test the relational operators and internal BIFs on lists and tuples.
  307: complex_relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  308:     Big = 99678557475484872464269855544643333,
  309:     Float = float(Big),
  310:     Bin = <<"abc">>,
  311:     BitString = <<0:7>>,
  312:     Map = #{a => b},
  313:     Vs0 = [an_atom,42.0,42,Big,Float,Bin,BitString,Map],
  314:     Vs = flatmap(fun(X) -> [unvalue({X}),unvalue([X])] end, Vs0),
  315:     Ops = ['==', '/=', '=:=', '=/=', '<', '=<', '>', '>='],
  316:     binop(Ops, Vs).
  317: 
  318: binop(Ops, Vs) ->
  319:     Run = fun(Op, N) -> Cases = [{Op,V1,V2} || V1 <- Vs, V2 <- Vs],
  320:                         run_test_module(Cases, true),
  321:                         N + length(Cases) end,
  322:     NumCases = foldl(Run, 0, Ops),
  323:     {comment,integer_to_list(NumCases) ++ " cases"}.
  324: 
  325: run_test_module(Cases, GuardsOk) ->
  326:     Es = [expr(C) || C <- Cases],
  327:     Ok = unvalue(ok),
  328:     Gts = case GuardsOk of
  329:               true ->
  330:                   Ges = [guard_expr(C) || C <- Cases],
  331:                   lists:foldr(fun guard_test/2, [Ok], Ges);
  332:               false ->
  333:                   [Ok]
  334:           end,
  335:     Fun1 = make_function(guard_tests, Gts),
  336:     Bts = lists:foldr(fun body_test/2, [Ok], Es),
  337:     Fun2 = make_function(body_tests, Bts),
  338:     Bbts = lists:foldr(fun internal_bif/2, [Ok], Es),
  339:     Fun3 = make_function(bif_tests, Bbts),
  340:     Id = {function,1,id,1,[{clause,1,[{var,1,'I'}],[],[{var,1,'I'}]}]},
  341:     Module0 = make_module(op_tests, [Fun1,Fun2,Fun3,Id]),
  342:     Module = erl_parse:new_anno(Module0),
  343:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> io:put_chars([erl_pp:form(F),"\n"]) end, Module),
  344: 
  345:     %% Compile, load, and run the generated module. Test both with and
  346:     %% without compiler optimizations to ensure that we test both the
  347:     %% implementation of the BIFs and the BEAM instructions.
  348:     do_run_test_module(Module, []),
  349:     do_run_test_module(Module, [no_copt,no_ssa_opt,no_postopt]).
  350: 
  351: do_run_test_module(Module, Opts) ->
  352:     {ok,Mod,Code1} = compile:forms(Module, [time|Opts]),
  353:     _ = code:delete(Mod),
  354:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  355: 
  356:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code1),
  357: 
  358:     run_function(Mod, guard_tests),
  359:     run_function(Mod, body_tests),
  360:     run_function(Mod, bif_tests),
  361: 
  362:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  363:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  364: 
  365:     ok.
  366: 
  367: expr({Op,X}) ->
  368:     E = {op,1,Op,{call,1,{atom,1,id},[X]}},
  369:     Res = eval([{op,1,Op,X}]),
  370:     {E,{Op,X},Res};
  371: expr({Op,X,Y}) ->
  372:     E = {op,1,Op,{call,1,{atom,1,id},[X]},Y},
  373:     Res = eval([{op,1,Op,X,Y}]),
  374:     {E,{Op,value(X),value(Y)},Res}.
  375: 
  376: guard_expr({Op,X}) ->
  377:     E = {op,1,Op,X},
  378:     Res = eval([E]),
  379:     {E,{Op,X},Res};
  380: guard_expr({Op,X,Y}) ->
  381:     E = {op,1,Op,X,Y},
  382:     Res = eval([E]),
  383:     {E,{Op,value(X),value(Y)},Res}.
  384: 
  385: run_function(Mod, Name) ->
  386:     case catch Mod:Name() of
  387:         {'EXIT',Reason} ->
  388:             io:format("~p", [get(last)]),
  389:             ct:fail({'EXIT',Reason});
  390:         _Other ->
  391:             ok
  392:     end.
  393: 
  394: guard_test({E,Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  395:     True = unvalue(true),
  396:     [save_term(Expr),
  397:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),
  398:       {'if',1,[{clause,1,[],[[E]],[True]},
  399:                {clause,1,[],[[True]],[unvalue(false)]}]}}|Tail].
  400: 
  401: body_test({E,Expr,{'EXIT',_}}, Tail) ->
  402:     [save_term(Expr),
  403:      {match,1,{tuple,1,[unvalue('EXIT'), {var,1,'_'}]},
  404:       {'catch',1,E}}|Tail];
  405: body_test({E,Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  406:     [save_term(Expr),
  407:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),E}|Tail].
  408: 
  409: internal_bif({{op,_,Op,X},Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  410:     internal_bif(Op, [X], Expr, Res, Tail);
  411: internal_bif({{op,_,Op,X,Y},Expr,Res}, Tail) ->
  412:     internal_bif(Op, [X,Y], Expr, Res, Tail).
  413: 
  414: internal_bif(Op, Args, Expr, {'EXIT',_}, Tail) ->
  415:     [save_term(Expr),
  416:      {match,1,{tuple,1,[unvalue('EXIT'), {var,1,'_'}]},
  417:       {'catch',1,{call,1,{remote,1,{atom,1,erlang},unvalue(Op)},Args}}}|Tail];
  418: internal_bif(Op, Args, Expr, Res, Tail) ->
  419:     [save_term(Expr),
  420:      {match,1,unvalue(Res),
  421:       {call,1,{remote,1,{atom,1,erlang},unvalue(Op)},Args}}|Tail].
  422: 
  423: save_term(Term) ->
  424:     {call,1,
  425:      {atom,1,put},
  426:      [{atom,1,last},unvalue(Term)]}.
  427: 
  428: make_module(Name, Funcs) ->
  429:     [{attribute,1,module,Name},
  430:      {attribute,0,compile,export_all} |
  431:      Funcs ++ [{eof,0}]].
  432: 
  433: make_function(Name, Body) ->
  434:     {function,1,Name,0,[{clause,1,[],[],Body}]}.
  435: 
  436: eval(E0) ->
  437:     E = erl_parse:new_anno(E0),
  438:     case catch erl_eval:exprs(E, []) of
  439:         {'EXIT',Reason} -> {'EXIT',Reason};
  440:         {value,Val,_Bs} -> Val
  441:     end.
  442: 
  443: unsafe_fusing(_Config) ->
  444:     0 = usec_to_seconds(id(1)),
  445:     234_567 = usec_to_seconds(id(1_234_567_890*1_000)),
  446:     ok.
  447: 
  448: usec_to_seconds(Usec) when is_integer(Usec) ->
  449:     %% The introduction of typed operands caused the loader
  450:     %% to incorrectly fuse the following instrutions because
  451:     %% the result register ({x,0}) from the 'div' instruction
  452:     %% seemed to be distinct from both operands of the 'rem'
  453:     %% instruction:
  454:     %%
  455:     %% {gc_bif,'div',
  456:     %%         {f,0},
  457:     %%         1,
  458:     %%         [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,any}},{integer,1000000}],
  459:     %%         {x,0}}.
  460:     %% {gc_bif,'rem',
  461:     %%         {f,0},
  462:     %%         1,
  463:     %%         [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,any}},{integer,1000000}],
  464:     %%         {x,0}}.
  465:     Sec = Usec div 1000000,
  466:     Sec rem 1000000.
  467: 
  468: range_tests(_Config) ->
  469:     %% Define the limits for smalls on a 64-bit system.
  470:     {MinSmall, MaxSmall} = {-1 bsl 59, (1 bsl 59) - 1},
  471:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  472:         8 ->
  473:             %% Assertions.
  474:             2 = erts_debug:flat_size(MinSmall-1),
  475:             0 = erts_debug:flat_size(MinSmall),
  476:             0 = erts_debug:flat_size(MaxSmall),
  477:             2 = erts_debug:flat_size(MaxSmall+1);
  478:         4 ->
  479:             ok
  480:     end,
  481: 
  482:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  483:     lesser = range(MinSmall),
  484:     lesser = range(0),
  485:     lesser = range(-1),
  486:     lesser = range(0.9999),
  487: 
  488:     inside = range_any(1),
  489:     inside = range_any(2),
  490:     inside = range_any(2.5),
  491:     inside = range_any(math:pi()),
  492:     inside = range_any(5),
  493:     inside = range_any(9),
  494:     inside = range_any(10),
  495: 
  496:     greater = range(10.0001),
  497:     greater = range(11),
  498:     greater = range(MaxSmall),
  499:     greater = range(1 bsl 64),
  500:     greater = range(atom),
  501:     greater = range(self()),
  502:     greater = range(make_ref()),
  503:     greater = range({a,b}),
  504:     greater = range([a,b]),
  505:     greater = range([]),
  506:     greater = range(<<1,2,3>>),
  507:     greater = range(fun() -> ok end),
  508:     greater = range(fun ?MODULE:range_tests/1),
  509: 
  510:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  511:     lesser = range(float(-1 bsl 64)),
  512:     lesser = range_big(MinSmall - 2),
  513:     lesser = range_barely_small(MinSmall - 1),
  514: 
  515:     inside = range_barely_small(MinSmall),
  516:     inside = range_barely_small(-1 bsl 58),
  517:     inside = range_barely_small(0),
  518:     inside = range_barely_small(17.75),
  519:     inside = range_barely_small(1 bsl 58),
  520:     inside = range_barely_small(MaxSmall),
  521: 
  522:     greater = range_barely_small(MaxSmall + 1),
  523:     greater = range_big(MaxSmall + 2),
  524:     greater = range_big(1 bsl 64),
  525:     greater = range_big(float(1 bsl 64)),
  526: 
  527:     lesser = range(-1 bsl 64),
  528:     lesser = range(float(-1 bsl 64)),
  529:     lesser = range_big(MinSmall - 2),
  530: 
  531:     inside = range_big(MinSmall),
  532:     inside = range_big(-1 bsl 58),
  533:     inside = range_big(0),
  534:     inside = range_big(17.75),
  535:     inside = range_big(1 bsl 58),
  536:     inside = range_big(MaxSmall),
  537: 
  538:     greater = range_big(MaxSmall + 2),
  539:     greater = range_big(1 bsl 64),
  540:     greater = range_big(float(1 bsl 64)),
  541: 
  542:     inside = int_range_1(id(-100_000)),
  543:     inside = int_range_1(id(-10)),
  544:     inside = int_range_1(id(100)),
  545:     inside = int_range_1(id(100_000)),
  546: 
  547:     outside = int_range_1(id(atom)),
  548:     outside = int_range_1(id(-1 bsl 60)),
  549:     outside = int_range_1(id(-100_001)),
  550:     outside = int_range_1(id(100_001)),
  551:     outside = int_range_1(id(1 bsl 60)),
  552: 
  553:     inside = int_range_2(id(1)),
  554:     inside = int_range_2(id(42)),
  555:     inside = int_range_2(id(16#f000_0000)),
  556: 
  557:     outside = int_range_2(id([a,list])),
  558:     outside = int_range_2(id(0)),
  559:     outside = int_range_1(id(-1 bsl 60)),
  560:     outside = int_range_1(id(1 bsl 60)),
  561: 
  562:     inside = int_range_3(id(1 bsl 28)),
  563:     inside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 28) + 1)),
  564:     inside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 33) + 555)),
  565:     inside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 58) - 1)),
  566:     inside = int_range_3(id(1 bsl 58)),
  567: 
  568:     outside = int_range_3(id({a,tuple})),
  569:     outside = int_range_3(id(-1 bsl 60)),
  570:     outside = int_range_3(id(-1000)),
  571:     outside = int_range_3(id(100)),
  572:     outside = int_range_3(id((1 bsl 58) + 1)),
  573:     outside = int_range_3(id(1 bsl 60)),
  574: 
  575:     ok.
  576: 
  577: range(X) ->
  578:     Res = range_any(X),
  579:     if
  580:         is_integer(X) ->
  581:             Res = range_any(float(X)),
  582:             Res = range_number(X),
  583:             Res = range_number(float(X)),
  584:             Res = range_int(X),
  585:             if
  586:                 X =:= X band 16#ffff ->
  587:                     Res = range_small_int(X);
  588:                 true ->
  589:                     Res
  590:             end;
  591:         is_number(X) ->
  592:             Res = range_number(X);
  593:         true ->
  594:             Res = range_big(X),
  595:             Res = range_barely_small(X)
  596:     end.
  597: 
  598: range_any(X0) ->
  599:     X = id(X0),
  600:     case range_any_1(X) of
  601:         inside ->
  602:             inside = range_any_2(X);
  603:         Other ->
  604:             outside = range_any_2(X),
  605:             Other
  606:     end.
  607: 
  608: %% The guard tests have different failure labels.
  609: range_any_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  610:     inside;
  611: range_any_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  612:     lesser;
  613: range_any_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  614:     greater.
  615: 
  616: %% The guard tests have the same failure label.
  617: range_any_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  618:     inside;
  619: range_any_2(_) ->
  620:     outside.
  621: 
  622: range_number(X) when is_number(X) ->
  623:     case range_number_1(X) of
  624:         inside ->
  625:             inside = range_number_2(X);
  626:         Other ->
  627:             outside = range_number_2(X),
  628:             Other
  629:     end.
  630: 
  631: range_number_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  632:     inside;
  633: range_number_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  634:     lesser;
  635: range_number_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  636:     greater.
  637: 
  638: range_number_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  639:     inside;
  640: range_number_2(_) ->
  641:     outside.
  642: 
  643: range_int(X) when is_integer(X) ->
  644:     case range_int_1(X) of
  645:         inside ->
  646:             inside = range_int_2(X);
  647:         Other ->
  648:             outside = range_int_2(X),
  649:             Other
  650:     end.
  651: 
  652: range_int_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  653:     inside;
  654: range_int_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  655:     lesser;
  656: range_int_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  657:     greater.
  658: 
  659: range_int_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  660:     inside;
  661: range_int_2(_) ->
  662:     outside.
  663: 
  664: range_small_int(X) when is_integer(X) ->
  665:     case range_small_int_1(X) of
  666:         inside ->
  667:             inside = range_small_int_2(X);
  668:         Other ->
  669:             outside = range_small_int_2(X),
  670:             Other
  671:     end.
  672: 
  673: range_small_int_1(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  674:     inside;
  675: range_small_int_1(X) when X < 1 ->
  676:     lesser;
  677: range_small_int_1(X) when X > 10 ->
  678:     greater.
  679: 
  680: range_small_int_2(X) when 1 =< X, X =< 10 ->
  681:     inside;
  682: range_small_int_2(_) ->
  683:     outside.
  684: 
  685: range_barely_small(X) ->
  686:     case range_barely_small_1(X) of
  687:         inside ->
  688:             inside = range_barely_small_2(X);
  689:         Other ->
  690:             outside = range_barely_small_2(X),
  691:             Other
  692:     end.
  693: 
  694: range_barely_small_1(X) when -1 bsl 59 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  695:     inside;
  696: range_barely_small_1(X) when X < -1 bsl 59 ->
  697:     lesser;
  698: range_barely_small_1(X) when X > (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  699:     greater.
  700: 
  701: range_barely_small_2(X) when -1 bsl 59 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  702:     inside;
  703: range_barely_small_2(_) ->
  704:     outside.
  705: 
  706: range_big(X) ->
  707:     case range_big_1(X) of
  708:         inside ->
  709:             inside = range_big_2(X);
  710:         Other ->
  711:             outside = range_big_2(X),
  712:             Other
  713:     end.
  714: 
  715: range_big_1(X) when (-1 bsl 59) - 1 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 59 ->
  716:     inside;
  717: range_big_1(X) when X < (-1 bsl 59) - 1 ->
  718:     lesser;
  719: range_big_1(X) when X > 1 bsl 59 ->
  720:     greater.
  721: 
  722: range_big_2(X) when (-1 bsl 59) - 1 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 59 ->
  723:     inside;
  724: range_big_2(_) ->
  725:     outside.
  726: 
  727: int_range_1(X) when is_integer(X), -100_000 =< X, X =< 100_000 ->
  728:     inside;
  729: int_range_1(_) ->
  730:     outside.
  731: 
  732: int_range_2(X) when is_integer(X), 1 =< X, X =< 16#f000_0000 ->
  733:     inside;
  734: int_range_2(_) ->
  735:     outside.
  736: 
  737: int_range_3(X) when is_integer(X), 1 bsl 28 =< X, X =< 1 bsl 58 ->
  738:     inside;
  739: int_range_3(_) ->
  740:     outside.
  741: 
  742: combined_relops(_Config) ->
  743:     other = test_tok_char(-1 bsl 64),
  744:     other = test_tok_char($A - 1),
  745: 
  746:     var = test_tok_char($A),
  747:     var = test_tok_char($B),
  748:     var = test_tok_char($P),
  749:     var = test_tok_char($Y),
  750:     var = test_tok_char($Z),
  751: 
  752:     other = test_tok_char($Z + 1),
  753: 
  754:     var = tok_char($_),
  755:     other = tok_char(float($_)),
  756: 
  757:     other = test_tok_char(1 bsl 64),
  758: 
  759:     other = test_tok_char(atom),
  760:     other = test_tok_char(self()),
  761: 
  762:     %%
  763:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-200),
  764:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-101),
  765: 
  766:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-100),
  767:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-50),
  768:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-10),
  769: 
  770:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-9),
  771:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-6),
  772: 
  773:     a = ge_ge_int_range_1(-5),
  774: 
  775:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(-4),
  776:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(0),
  777:     b = ge_ge_int_range_1(42),
  778: 
  779:     %%
  780:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2(-1 bsl 59),
  781: 
  782:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2((-1 bsl 59) + 1),
  783:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2(-1 bsl 58),
  784:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2(-1000),
  785:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2(1 bsl 58),
  786:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 10),
  787: 
  788:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 9),
  789: 
  790:     a = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 5),
  791: 
  792:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 4),
  793:     b = ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 1),
  794: 
  795:     %%
  796:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(-1 bsl 59),
  797: 
  798:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((-1 bsl 59) + 1),
  799:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(-1 bsl 58),
  800:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(-1000),
  801:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3(1 bsl 58),
  802: 
  803:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 20),
  804:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 15),
  805:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 10),
  806: 
  807:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 9),
  808: 
  809:     a = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 5),
  810: 
  811:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 4),
  812:     b = ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 1),
  813: 
  814:     %%
  815:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4(-1 bsl 59),
  816: 
  817:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 1),
  818:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 3),
  819:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 5),
  820: 
  821:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 6),
  822:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 9),
  823: 
  824:     a = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 10),
  825: 
  826:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 11),
  827: 
  828:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4(0),
  829:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4(1000),
  830: 
  831:     b = ge_ge_int_range_4((1 bsl 59) - 1),
  832: 
  833:     %% Test a sequence that can't occur in optimized code:
  834:     %%   is_ge Fail Src 10
  835:     %%   is_ge Fail Src 5
  836:     Module = {?FUNCTION_NAME,[{test,1}],[],
  837:               [{function, test, 1, 2,
  838:                 [{label,1},
  839:                  {line,[{location,"t.erl",4}]},
  840:                  {func_info,{atom,?FUNCTION_NAME},{atom,test},1},
  841:                  {label,2},
  842:                  {test,is_ge,{f,4},
  843:                   [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,{0,1000}}},
  844:                    {integer,10}]},
  845:                  {test,is_ge,
  846:                   {f,3},
  847:                   [{tr,{x,0},{t_integer,{0,1000}}},
  848:                    {integer,5}]},
  849:                  {label,3},
  850:                  {move,{atom,a},{x,0}},
  851:                  return,
  852:                  {label,4},
  853:                  {move,{atom,b},{x,0}},
  854:                  return]}],
  855:               5},
  856: 
  857:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:forms(Module, [from_asm,time,report]),
  858:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code),
  859: 
  860:     b = Mod:test(0),
  861:     b = Mod:test(5),
  862:     b = Mod:test(9),
  863: 
  864:     a = Mod:test(10),
  865:     a = Mod:test(11),
  866:     a = Mod:test(1000),
  867: 
  868:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  869:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  870: 
  871:     ok.
  872: 
  873: test_tok_char(C) ->
  874:     Result = tok_char(C),
  875:     if
  876:         is_integer(C) ->
  877:             Result = tok_char(float(C)),
  878:             Result = tok_char_int(C),
  879:             if
  880:                 C band 16#FFFF =:= C ->
  881:                     Result = tok_char_int_range(C);
  882:                 true ->
  883:                     Result
  884:             end;
  885:         true ->
  886:             Result
  887:     end.
  888: 
  889: %% is_ge + is_lt
  890: tok_char(C) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  891:     var;
  892: tok_char($_) ->
  893:     var;
  894: tok_char(_) ->
  895:     other.
  896: 
  897: %% is_ge + is_ge
  898: tok_char_int(C) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  899:     var;
  900: tok_char_int($_) ->
  901:     var;
  902: tok_char_int(_) ->
  903:     other.
  904: 
  905: %% is_ge + is_ge
  906: tok_char_int_range(C) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
  907:     var;
  908: tok_char_int_range($_) ->
  909:     var;
  910: tok_char_int_range(_) ->
  911:     other.
  912: 
  913: %% is_ge + is_ge
  914: ge_ge_int_range_1(X) when -100 =< X, X =< -10 ->
  915:     a;
  916: ge_ge_int_range_1(-5) ->
  917:     a;
  918: ge_ge_int_range_1(_) ->
  919:     b.
  920: 
  921: ge_ge_int_range_2(X) when (-1 bsl 59) + 1 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 10 ->
  922:     a;
  923: ge_ge_int_range_2((1 bsl 59) - 5) ->
  924:     a;
  925: ge_ge_int_range_2(_) ->
  926:     b.
  927: 
  928: ge_ge_int_range_3(X) when (1 bsl 59) - 20 =< X, X =< (1 bsl 59) - 10 ->
  929:     a;
  930: ge_ge_int_range_3((1 bsl 59) - 5) ->
  931:     a;
  932: ge_ge_int_range_3(_) ->
  933:     b.
  934: 
  935: ge_ge_int_range_4(X) when (-1 bsl 59) + 1 =< X, X =< (-1 bsl 59) + 5 ->
  936:     a;
  937: ge_ge_int_range_4((-1 bsl 59) + 10) ->
  938:     a;
  939: ge_ge_int_range_4(_) ->
  940:     b.
  941: 
  942: %% Tests operators where type hints are significant.
  943: typed_relop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  944:     _ = [compare_integer_pid(1 bsl N) || N <- lists:seq(1, 64)],
  945: 
  946:     {error,<<7:3>>} = compare_bitstring({text, <<7:3>>, 0}),
  947:     {error,<<0:8>>} = compare_bitstring({text, <<0:8>>, 0}),
  948:     {error,<<0:9>>} = compare_bitstring({text, <<0:9>>, 0}),
  949:     {text, 42} = compare_bitstring({text, <<0:3>>, 42}),
  950: 
  951:     {error,<<7:3>>} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<7:3>>, 0}),
  952:     {error,<<0:8>>} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<0:8>>, 0}),
  953:     {error,<<0:9>>} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<0:9>>, 0}),
  954:     {binary, 42} = compare_bitstring({binary, <<0:3>>, 42}),
  955: 
  956:     ok.
  957: 
  958: compare_integer_pid(N) when is_integer(N) ->
  959:     Immed = self(),
  960:     true = is_pid(Immed),
  961:     if
  962:         N >= Immed -> ct:fail("integer compared greater than pid");
  963:         N < Immed -> ok
  964:     end.
  965: 
  966: %% GH-7433. Equality and non-equality tests with a bitstring could fail when it
  967: %% should succeed and vice versa.
  968: compare_bitstring({text, Res, _Data}) when is_bitstring(Res), Res =/= <<0:3>> ->
  969:     {error, Res};
  970: compare_bitstring({binary, Res, _Data}) when is_bitstring(Res), Res =/= <<0:3>> ->
  971:     {error, Res};
  972: compare_bitstring({binary, _Res, Data}) ->
  973:     {binary, Data};
  974: compare_bitstring({text, _Res, Data}) ->
  975:     {text, Data}.
  976: 
  977: %%%
  978: %%% Utilities.
  979: %%%
  980: 
  981: unvalue(V) ->
  982:     Abstr = erl_parse:abstract(V),
  983:     erl_parse:anno_to_term(Abstr).
  984: 
  985: value({nil,_}) -> [];
  986: value({integer,_,X}) -> X;
  987: value({string,_,X}) -> X;
  988: value({float,_,X})   -> X;
  989: value({atom,_,X})    -> X;
  990: value({tuple,_,Es}) ->
  991:     list_to_tuple(lists:map(fun(X) -> value(X) end, Es));
  992: value({cons,_,H,T}) ->
  993:     [value(H) | value(T)];
  994: value(Other) ->
  995:     {value,Value,_} = erl_eval:expr(Other, erl_eval:new_bindings()),
  996:     Value.
  997: 
  998: repeat(_, 0) -> ok;
  999: repeat(Fun, N) ->
 1000:     Fun(),
 1001:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
 1002: 
 1003: id(I) -> I.
